cleaned_text: Chinese Medicine is an open access journal publishing evidence-based, scientifically justified research and review papers in all aspects of Chinese medicine, including - but not limited to - chemistry, biology, pharmacology, pharmaceutics, engineering, clinical applications and socioeconomics that are relevant and significant to Chinese medicine. [Call for papers](/cfp-research-advances-in-natural-products-from-herbal-medicine) We invite you to submit an article to the thematic series: Research advances in natural products from herbal medicine. Articles - - [Characterization of ginsenosides from Panax japonicus var. major in a mouse model](/articles/10.1186/s13020-023-00824-7) - [Schisandrin protects against ulcerative colitis by inhibiting the SGK1/NLRP3 signaling pathway and reshaping gut microbiota in mice](/articles/10.1186/s13020-023-00815-8) - [Techniques for extraction and isolation of natural products: a comprehensive review](/articles/10.1186/s13020-018-0177-x) - [Beneficial effects of green tea: A literature review](/articles/10.1186/1749-8546-5-13) - [Conservation and sustainable use of medicinal plants: problems, progress, and prospects](/articles/10.1186/s13020-016-0108-7) - [Chinese herbal medicine for gout: a review of the clinical evidence and pharmacological mechanisms](/articles/10.1186/s13020-020-0297-y) - [Anti-cancer natural products isolated from chinese medicinal herbs](/articles/10.1186/1749-8546-6-27) Aims and scope Chinese Medicine is an open access journal publishing evidence-based, scientifically justified research and review papers in all aspects of Chinese medicine, including - but not limited to - chemistry, biology, pharmacology, pharmaceutics, engineering, clinical applications and socioeconomics that are relevant and significant to Chinese medicine. Thematic series [Developing the evidence base for Traditional and Complementary Medicine](https://www.biomedcentral.com/collections/dtcm) Guest edited by Dr Joanna Harnett and Dr Carolina Oi Lam Ung [Omics Approaches in Natural Products towards Modernization of Chinese Medicine](https://www.biomedcentral.com/collections/omicsapproaches) Guest edited by Prof Milen I. Georgiev and Prof Jian-Bo Wan [Pharmacology and applications of Chinese medicine](https://www.biomedcentral.com/collections/PACM) Guest edited by Prof Milen I. Georgiev and Prof Ruibing Wang Announcing the launch of In Review Chinese Medicine, in partnership with Research Square, is now offering In Review. Authors choosing this free optional service will be able to: - Share their work with fellow researchers to read, comment on, and cite even before publication - Showcase their work to funders and others with a citable DOI while it is still under review - Track their manuscript - including seeing when reviewers are invited, and when reports are received Society affiliations Chinese Medicine is the official journal of the [International Society for Chinese Medicine](https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__www.iscm.org.mo_&d=DwIDaQ&c=vh6FgFnduejNhPPD0fl_yRaSfZy8CWbWnIf4XJhSqx8&r=xrmxKmAa-K4BqRBYeYKV4jkSfNfvlBD98iczlvgYitY&m=vkxtmlW6NVS0ogx70a3aj3JXJMv2gfprYko2M30wx1w&s=fPSB7PHQi7Pm2zobPxiK7b44KLis0Jm2kzAc5DGaRGc&e=). The editorial office is based in Macao and sponsored by the Macao Foundation and [University of Macau](http://www.umac.mo/).
